result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad D. Duwe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
No contact with victims unless authorized by agent. 

Absolute sobriety.  Take all medications as prescribed.  Comply with mental health assessment and any follow up.

Participate in any assessment, counseling and treatment as deemed appropriate by agent. 

*Amended: Defendant plead no contest. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad D. Duwe

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 9:41 a.m. 
**Includes 15CF24 & 15CF321**
State appears by ADA Desiree Toldt. Defendant appears in custody with Attorney Julie Sawyer.  Date & time set for Preliminary Hearing in 15CF321 and Plea/Sentencing on both files. 
Parties proceed with Preliminary Hearing in 15CF321.
Waiver of Prelim. filed. 
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived.
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief filed. 
State files amended Information in 15CF24, delete repeater enhancer on Ct.2. 
State moves to: 15CF24- DRI Ct.1- Interfere w/Child Custody. 15CF321- DRI Ct.2- Bail Jumping (Felony) & DRI Ct.3- Bail Jumping (Felony)
COURT GRANTS. 
PLEA: 15CF24 Ct.2- Disorderly Conduct>>NO CONTEST                     
           15CF321 Ct.1- Bail Jumping (Felony)>>NO CONTEST
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: 15CF24 Ct.2- SWH, 1 year probation concurrent to 15CF321. CONDITIONS: Comply with mental health assessment and any follow up, no contact with victims unless authorized by agent, absolute sobriety, take all medications as prescribed, participate in any assessment, counseling and treatment as deemed appropriate by agent, CC & DNA surcharge. Defendant is entitled to 9 days credit if revoked.
15CF321 Ct.1- SWH,  2 years probation concurrent to 15CF24. CONDITIONS: Same as 15CF24 but with added condition of no contact with victim, K.N. Defendant is entitled to 14 days credit if revoked.
